lessons.text: Missing Android permissions in AndroidManifest.xml.: Flutter auto-adds permissions in debug builds but NOT in release builds.
ALWAYS add permissions explicitly in AndroidManifest for release builds.: Debug mode auto-adds INTERNET and other permissions. Release mode does NOT. This was hours of debugging for 3 lines of XML.
**AndroidManifest permissions differ between debug and release** - CRITICAL
**Flutter version matching matters** - framework, engine, and Dart SDK must all be from same release
**Subagents can claim success without delivering** - always verify file existence
**Don't ask permission to fix things** - SOUL.md principle #1 violated multiple times today
**Claude Code can't run as root** - `--dangerously-skip-permissions` blocked for root users
**Proxy rotation = essential for scaling** - IP diversity prevents bot detection
**Competitive intelligence through reverse engineering** - Leaked prompts reveal industry techniques

decisions.action: **Code fix:** Replaced all `.withValues(alpha: X)` with `.withOpacity(X)` (withValues doesn't exist in Dart 3.2.6)
decisions.outcome: **Code fix:** Replaced all `.withValues(alpha: X)` with `.withOpacity(X)` (withValues doesn't exist in Dart 3.2.6)
v1.0.10 (code 10): Flutter 3.16.9 matched SDK, still crashed (missing permissions)

decisions.outcome: Fix errors immediately. Don't ask. Don't wait.

facts.fact: - Video upload fix: Must use -F "video=@filepath" (multipart with @ prefix)
